extArch.title: Extension System Architecture
extArch.subtitle: Deep dive into how extensions are sandboxed, communicate with haex-vault, and integrate with the sync system.

overview.title: Extension Overview
overview.intro: Extensions are sandboxed web applications that run within haex-vault. They can access vault data through the SDK while being isolated from the host system and each other.

sandbox.title: Sandboxed Isolation
sandbox.description: Extensions run in isolated environments with explicit permissions for each action.

sdk.title: Unified SDK
sdk.description: The haex-vault-sdk provides a consistent API regardless of the display mode.

database.title: Own Database Tables
database.description: Extensions can create and manage their own tables with automatic CRDT sync.

sync.title: Automatic Sync
sync.description: Extension data is automatically synced across devices using the same CRDT system.

displayModes.title: Display Modes
displayModes.intro: Extensions can run in two modes depending on the platform. The SDK abstracts away the differences.

lifecycle.title: Extension Lifecycle
lifecycle.intro: Extensions go through a defined lifecycle from installation to runtime.

sync.title: Cross-Device Installation
sync.description: When you install an extension, the metadata is synced to other devices. However, the extension files must be downloaded separately on each device from the marketplace.

permissions.title: Permission System
permissions.intro: Extensions must declare permissions in their manifest. Users grant or deny these permissions during installation.

communication.title: Extension Communication
communication.intro: Extensions communicate with the host through different mechanisms depending on the display mode.

devMode.title: Development Mode
devMode.intro: During development, extensions can be loaded from a local dev server with hot reload support.

hotReload.title: Hot Reload
hotReload.description: Changes to your extension code are reflected immediately without reinstalling.

localOnly.title: Local-Only Data
localOnly.description: Dev extension tables are NOT synced to other devices. They use CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS for idempotency.

important.title: No CRDT Triggers
important.description: Dev extension tables don't get CRDT triggers, so changes are local-only. Production extensions get full sync support.

syncEvents.title: Receiving Sync Updates
syncEvents.intro: Extensions can listen for sync events to reload their data when changes arrive from other devices.

automatic.title: Automatic Table Prefix
automatic.description: Extension tables are automatically prefixed with the extension's public key and name, so you only receive events for your own tables.
